newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai sells half of its latest state bond quota.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai sells half of its latest state bond quota.

text.p: Shanghai city has sold 2.876 billion yuan of the latest state debt issue which began on May 1, accounting for 56.62 percent of the total amount allocated to issue in the city, Thursday's Shanghai Securities News said.

The three-year bond issue, totalling 40 billion yuan ($4.8 billion), is denominated in 100 yuan, 1,000 yuan, and 5,000 yuan amounts with an annual coupon rate of 9.18 percent and can be traded immediately after the issue closes, the official media has reported. ($1 = 8.3 yuan)
